intro: Neolitsea kedahensis, commonly known as Kedah litsea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to the Malay Peninsula and is found in lowland rainforests. The plant is characterized by its aromatic, leathery leaves and small, fragrant white flowers. It produces dark blue to black berries that are edible but not commonly consumed by humans. Neolitsea kedahensis plays a role in local ecosystems and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
